013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
019
020import java.net.*;
021import java.util.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026
027/**
028 * An object representing a Server.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * The Server Object represents a server that provides connectivity information to a target server. This can be used 
032 * to specify different servers for different environments (e.g., development, staging, production) or to provide 
033 * server-specific configuration such as variables for templating.
034 *
035 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
036 * <p>
037 * The Server Object is composed of the following fields:
038 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
039 *    <li><c>url</c> (string, REQUIRED) - A URL to the target host. This URL supports Server Variables and may be relative
040 *    <li><c>description</c> (string) - An optional string describing the host designated by the URL (CommonMark syntax may be used)
041 *    <li><c>variables</c> (map of {@link ServerVariable}) - A map between a variable name and its value
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
045 * <p class='bjava'>
046 *    <jc>// Create a server with variables</jc>
047 *    Server <jv>server</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Server()
048 *       .setUrl(<js>"https://{username}.gigantic-server.com:{port}/{basePath}"</js>)
049 *       .setDescription(<js>"The production API server"</js>)
050 *       .setVariables(
051 *          JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(
052 *             <js>"username"</js>, <jk>new</jk> ServerVariable()
053 *                .setDefault(<js>"demo"</js>)
054 *                .setDescription(<js>"this value is assigned by the service provider"</js>),
055 *             <js>"port"</js>, <jk>new</jk> ServerVariable()
056 *                .setDefault(<js>"8443"</js>)
057 *                .setEnum(<js>"8443"</js>, <js>"443"</js>),
058 *             <js>"basePath"</js>, <jk>new</jk> ServerVariable()
059 *                .setDefault(<js>"v2"</js>)
060 *          )
061 *       );
062 * </p>
063 *
064 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
065 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#server-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; Server Object</a>
066 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/api-host-and-base-path/">OpenAPI API Host and Base Path</a>
067 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi3</a>
068 * </ul>
069 */
070@FluentSetters
071public class Server extends OpenApiElement{
072   private URI url;
073   private String description;
074   private Map<String,ServerVariable> variables;
075
076   /**
077    * Default constructor.
078    */
079   public Server() { }
080
081   /**
082    * Copy constructor.
083    *
084    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
085    */
086   public Server(Server copyFrom) {
087      super(copyFrom);
088
089      this.url = copyFrom.url;
090      this.description = copyFrom.description;
091      this.variables = copyOf(copyFrom.variables, ServerVariable::copy);
092   }
093
094   /**
095    * Make a deep copy of this object.
096    *
097    * @return A deep copy of this object.
098    */
099   public Server copy() {
100      return new Server(this);
101   }
102
103   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
104   protected Server strict() {
105      super.strict();
106      return this;
107   }
108
109   @Override /* GENERATED - do not modify */
110   public Server strict(Object value) {
111      super.strict(value);
112      return this;
113   }
114
115   /**
116    * Bean property getter:  <property>url</property>.
117    *
118    * <p>
119    * The URL pointing to the contact information.
120    *
121    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
122    */
123   public URI getUrl() {
124      return url;
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Bean property setter:  <property>url</property>.
129    *
130    * <p>
131    * The value can be of any of the following types: {@link URI}, {@link URL}, {@link String}.
132    * <br>Strings must be valid URIs.
133    *
134    * <p>
135    * URIs defined by {@link UriResolver} can be used for values.
136    *
137    * @param value
138    *    The new value for this property.
139    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
140    * @return This object
141    */
142   public Server setUrl(URI value) {
143      url = value;
144      return this;
145   }
146
147   /**
148    * Bean property getter:  <property>description</property>.
149    *
150    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
151    */
152   public String getDescription() {
153      return description;
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
158    *
159    * @param value
160    *    The new value for this property.
161    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
162    * @return This object
163    */
164   public Server setDescription(String value) {
165      description = value;
166      return this;
167   }
168
169   /**
170    * Bean property getter:  <property>variables</property>.
171    *
172    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
173    */
174   public Map<String, ServerVariable> getVariables() {
175      return variables;
176   }
177
178   /**
179    * Bean property setter:  <property>variables</property>.
180    *
181    * @param value
182    *    The new value for this property.
183    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
184    * @return This object
185    */
186   public Server setVariables(Map<String, ServerVariable> value) {
187      variables = copyOf(value);
188      return this;
189   }
190
191   /**
192    * Adds one or more values to the <property>variables</property> property.
193    *
194    * @param key The mapping key.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
195    * @param value
196    *    The values to add to this property.
197    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
198    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
199    * @return This object
200    */
201   public Server addVariable(String key, ServerVariable value) {
202      assertArgNotNull("key", key);
203      assertArgNotNull("value", value);
204      variables = mapBuilder(variables).sparse().add(key, value).build();
205      return this;
206   }
207
208   // <FluentSetters>
209
210   // </FluentSetters>
211
212   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
213   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
214      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
215      return switch (property) {
216         case "url" -> toType(getUrl(), type);
217         case "description" -> toType(getDescription(), type);
218         case "variables" -> toType(getVariables(), type);
219         default -> super.get(property, type);
220      };
221   }
222
223   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
224   public Server set(String property, Object value) {
225      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
226      return switch (property) {
227         case "description" -> setDescription(Utils.s(value));
228         case "url" -> setUrl(toURI(value));
229         case "variables" -> setVariables(mapBuilder(String.class,ServerVariable.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
230         default -> {
231            super.set(property, value);
232            yield this;
233         }
234      };
235   }
236
237   @Override /* OpenApiElement */
238   public Set<String> keySet() {
239      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
240         .addIf(description != null, "description")
241         .addIf(url != null, "url")
242         .addIf(variables != null, "variables")
243         .build();
244      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
245   }
246}
